data.title: WhatMayBe.Life – Kat & Jared, circus artists
data.text:
DYNAMIC ACROBATICS WITH SOFT CONNECTION

Performances & Projects

Play Video

Immersive paths in urban nature relating to our feelings of belonging and memories of place. Theatre, Circus, visual arts and sound in Collaboration with Oulu University and Acting for Climate

Tickets & more information: https://whatmaybe.life/polku/

Do you dare enter a world of nightly visions and hallucination, surrealism and decadence?

NIGHTTOWN, an immersive performance inspired by Chapter 15 of James Joyce’s famed Ulysses takes over the former Bank of Finland building in Oulu.

https://www.flowprod.fi/en/portfolio/nighttown/

Touring performance. Dance, circus, local photography and stories of changing winters. Supported by The Arts Promotion Centre Finland (Taiteen edistämiskeskus – Taike), Taikabox ry, & Oulun Tähtisirkus ry.

https://whatmaybe.life/shapesofwater/

Play Video

Immersive performance. Directed by Pirjo Yli-Maunula. Performers: Jared and Katariina Van Earle, Marta Alstadsæter, Kim-Jomi Fischer, Henna Kaikula, Anssi Laiho, Nikke Launonen, Merja Pietilä, Susanna Pukkila, Milla Virtanen. Premiere 2022.

https://whatmaybe.life/varikko/

Play Video

Negotiation

A piece combining dance and circus in collaboration with dancer choreographer Heli Pippingsköld & Danish dancer-sound designer SImon Beyer-Pedersen.

Kaboom & the power of imagination

- Oulu City Theatre

Production for Oulu City Theatre main stage. Directed by Alma Lehmuskallio, choreography by Jenni Nikolajeff. 2020-2022

https://teatteri.ouka.fi/naytelma/kaboom/

2x4

Circus duet with a plank of wood, premiered as part of Varjakka Revisited, further performances Welcome to Oulu, Illallinen Konttorilla, Kaupunkifoorumi and Tornio 400. Creation supported by Oulun valistustalorahasto, Taike and Dansinitiativet Sirkusresidens.

Varjakka Revisited

Dance and circus for Flow Productions immersive piece from 2014 now performed for Kotiseutupäivät on Varjakka island.

Dancing on the Margins of Climate Change - Dance Artists in Barents 2020

Research work and two seminars (research days in Luleå and online virtual research days in Oulu) before releasing our contract due to Corona-related change of schedules and concept.

Artist from Norway, Finland, Sweden and Russia.

Play Video

Dancing in the rain

Choreography and dance for a music video for

Three in the Dark. https://m.youtube.com/.watch?v=wa1qsrmeS9U

Play Video

Growth and a Friend

Augmented Reality/videomapping with circus, a theatre production presenting the ridiculous, grueling and touching moments of life. Creation and research supported by Taike grant, Finnish Arts Center 2019 & Oulun Tähtisirkus ry.

Play Video

Work in Progress Performances

12 minutes, performing at various locations.

Previous performances include Swedish Acrobatics Festival Gala (SE), Norwich Fly High Circus Convention (UK), Israel Acrobatics Convention Gala 2019, TAC street art festival Valladolid (ES).

Play Video

Oulu Dance Hack - TaikaBox

Oulu Dance Hack is an annual research and performance event that is organised by TaikaBox and Oulu University of Applied Sciences (OAMK) to bring together art, industry and education in a unique way. We join as participants to explore technology in a performance context, connecting with artists from across the globe and performing to thousands of visitors at Oulu Light Festival (LUMO).

Read more on the TaikaBox website

Play Video

TAC

Performance at TAC street art festival in Valladolid, Spain. 12 minute solo performance and part of 2 hour show.

We love to teach

A wide range of skills, all weaved with carefully thought pedagogy and drills to make your acro practice feel smooth and connected. Our workshops are a unique blend. We work more on concepts and movement patterns that are the key to learn any new skill.

Where to find us

Here you can find all our upcoming workshops. Click on an event to find out more information and book your spot

Do you know a studio or event that would like to host a workshop/performance from us?

Other Projects

Midnight Sun Acrobatics Convention - Lapland 2019

The worlds northernmost Acrobatics convention will happen for the first time this summer solstice (20.-24.6.) in Lapland Tornio, where the sun will never set and acro never stop! It will be a semi-catered exclusively intermediate-advanced convention with only 30 participant spots open this year with at least 6 teachers sharing their skills and devotion to you. Don't miss your chance to fulfill your dream to experience the nightless night, Midsummers Eve on a Finnish seaside cottage with forest and saunas... combining it to your favourite thing: Doing loads of Acro with friends. http://midnightsunacro.com/

Creation & Research March 2019

Things we worked on at Carampa Circus School in early 2019.

AcroYoga Week Helsinki

Every year on the first week of August. Join us and Jill & Heidi from AcroYoga Montreal for a full week of acro fun in the capital of Finland! More info

AcroVentures

We set the stage, organise the camp, maintain training and acro inspiration – then the adventure is yours! We work with professional teachers to offer a concept of workshops on the road while exploring new countries. View trailer or visit the website. AcroVentures concept is happy to come to your country, if you have an idea we can create a trip together. Please contact AcroVentures directly
